page.title: 02Endon Well Dressing.
page.content: In the village of Endon there has been a Well Dressing Festival for over a century.It is an annual festival of thanksgiving held on the last weekend in May.A girl aged 10-11,residing in the parish,is chosen to be the Well Dressing Queen.On Saturday a service of Thanksgiving is held at Endon Parish Church when the sermon deals mainly with the gift of water.Then the Queen leads a procession down to the Well, where the water is blessed, usually by a visiting Clergyman.The Queen is crowned in a nearby field and local children dance around the May Pole. A pole is set up in the middle of a circle of dancers.Each dancer holds a long ribbon which is fastened to the top of a pole.During the dance the children weave in and out until the ribbons are plaited in a beautiful pattern around the Maypole.
